title: #FakeHunter Challenge Geopolitics
quote: „Take the challenge and join the fight against fake news by creating a network without fake. You also have an influence on what others read.”

section1.title: About the challenge
section1.subtitle: What is fake news and why is it so dangerous?
section1.description: In cyberspace, false information, popularly known as fakes, is appearing more and more often on a scale larger than you think. They pertain to many areas of life, consciously or without being misleading. Anyone can be a victim of disinformation or even fraud. Without realizing what fake news is and how powerful it is, we believe what we read and watch too easily. The time of the coronavirus pandemic has shown the importance of the fight against false information. People started to believe that 5G technology causes Covid-19 disease and cancer, vaccines cause autism, and wearing face masks can be dangerous to your health. The victims of information scams on the Internet are, among others, ordinary people, public figures, companies whose market value is destroyed due to fake news.
section1.button: We have plenty of examples of fake news!

section8.description2: The entries will be assessed by a jury consisting of specialists - editors and journalists of the Fake Hunter portal, who verify false and manipulated information published on the web on a daily basis.
section8.description3: <0>In addition to cash prizes, we also have a special prize for you </0>

section12.title: EXPERT MEETINGS WITH PAP
section12.subtitle: War takes place also online - what propaganda and disinformation messages are used by the Russians? Poland abroad - image in foreign media. What distortions about our country do we observe in the global media?
section12.description: Our guests will be: journalists, political scientists, publicists, analysts dealing with international affairs. We will talk with them about the armed conflict in Ukraine, disinformation inspired and led by the Kremlin. We will try to trace the scale of fake news that appears about Poland in the foreign press and we will consider together with experts what it results from and how we should react.
section12.description1: Conversations with invited guests will be broadcast live on <0>https://fakehunter.pap.pl</0> during the first and second day of the competition. Watch!

section13.title: CONTEST
section13.subtitle: The 5th edition of the #FakeHunter Challenge Geopolitics competition on March 25th -27th
section13.description: We invite everyone who wants to promote the idea of access to credible and reliable information to the <0>#FakeHunter Challenge</0> competition. Every day we are exposed to the danger of false and manipulated content concerning political, military and economic activities of various countries and their consequences. This is especially important now as we witness Russian aggression against Ukraine. The scale of fake news aimed at generating social unrest, arousing anxiety and panic in the world is spreading like a virus.
section13.description1: That's why we want to fight disinformation! Join the competition! Together, we have a stronger influence on what others read.
section13.description2: <0>The main theme of the 5th edition of the competition is geopolitics, i.e. the activities of countries covering the political, economic, military, diplomatic and energy spheres.</0>
section13.description3: Within three days, registered people, acting independently or in teams, will be able to report false information published on the Internet regarding, among others, the armed conflict in Ukraine, Russian military and political activities, tensions around Poland, Ukraine, the Baltic countries, the image of the Polish state , distorting the history of Poland.
